isis.stitle: POWER STEERING GEAR: SHEPPARD M-SERIES - PREVENTIVE MAINTENANCE - CLEANING RELIEF VALVE SEATS

important.para: Do not remove the steering gear for this procedure.

svcprocinfo.para: If the driver complains of lack of power or hard steering in one direction, there is contamination under the plunger relief ball. The contamination will have to be removed before power steering can be restored.

step1.para: Park the vehicle on a clean, dry, solid surface. Set the parking brake, block the rear wheels and place the transmission in neutral.
Raise the front end of the vehicle until the tires have cleared the surface, using the hydraulic jack. Set the front axle on floor stands.

warning.para: A jack must never be used alone to support vehicle while under-chassis service is being performed. The jack may lower and serious personal injury could result. Always support vehicle with floor stands.

step1.para: Place the drain pan under the steering gear to catch the fluid from the system.

note.para: Remove the pressure line from the center of the cap on dual steering systems (if equipped).

step1.para: Make a reference mark on the end cap and a matching mark on the housing. Use the proper size socket and ratchet to remove the four attaching bolts from the cylinder head end cap (the end opposite the input shaft.) Remove the end cap.

note.para: Fluid will drain from the steering gear when the end cap is removed.

caution.para: Be careful not to bend or break the plunger in the end cap.

step1.para: Slowly turn steering shaft until the steering gear piston comes to within 1 inch (25 mm) of e open end of steering gear housing.

caution.para: Do not allow any foreign material to enter the steering gear housing. Steering will be affected and damage to the gear may result.

figure.caption: Figure 11. Remove Allen Head Valve Seat

warning.para: Slight spring tension will be present. Care must be taken to prevent injury and loss of parts. Always wear safety glasses.

step1.para: When seat is removed, the plunger ball, spring, plastic insert and the plunger ball from the opposite end of the piston will come out of the passage ( Figure 11).

figure.caption: Figure 12. Plunger Ball, Spring, and Plastic Insert

note.para: Depending on steering gear mounting, a magnet may be needed to remove the relief ball from the passage.

step1.para: Insert a bottle brush large enough in diameter to clean the bore into the passage and move it back and forth while turning it to clean the passage after the fluid has drained ( Figure 12).
If heavy contamination is present, find and fix the source of contaminants. Flush the system.
Clean all removed parts in an approved fluid and blow dry using low pressure air.

warning.para: Always wear safety glasses and use only low pressure air to clean parts.

step1.para: Install the parts in the relief passage. Install one relief ball, the spring with insert, the remaining relief ball and Allen seat. Use an Allen wrench to tighten the seat until it bottoms ( Figure 13).

figure.caption: Figure 14. Tighten Seat Until It Bottoms

warning.para: It will be necessary to compress the spring during assembly. Use care to insure parts are not lost during assembly. Always wear safety glasses to avoid injuries.

step1.para: Install the end cap and attaching bolts; be sure to align the reference marks ( Figure 14). Tighten the attaching bolts to 35 ft-lbs. (47 Nm). Connect the pressure line in the center of the cap for dual steering systems (if equipped).

figure.caption: Figure 15. Install End Cap and Attaching Bolts

caution.para: Be careful not to damage the plunger during reassembly.

step1.para: Fill the reservoir to the proper level. Refer to TYPES OF FLUID for the correct type of fluid for the model vehicle being serviced.
Raise the front axle and remove the floor stands. Slowly lower the front tires onto the surface. Remove the jack and drain pan.
Place the transmission in neutral and start the vehicle. Allow it to idle while the fluid circulates.
Bleed the system using the procedures listed in BLEEDING (Dual system only).
Check and refill the reservoir as needed.

note.para: No plunger adjustment is necessary unless the adjustment was changed during disassembly or reassembly. If it was changed, refer to SET RELIEF PLUNGERS.
